alert.note: Alert for Butler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 8:06PM CDT until April 30 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Nebraska and northeast Nebraska, including the following counties, in east central Nebraska, Butler. In northeast Nebraska, Boone, Madison and Platte. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 806 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbus, Madison, Newman Grove, St. Edward, Duncan, Platte Center, Monroe, Lindsay, Creston, Humphrey, Tarnov, Cornlea, Circle H Trailer Park, Lake Ocaonee, College View Trailer Park, Lake North Babcock Campground, Central Community College, Shell Creek Elementary School and Camp Pawnee.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
